text: Andria Tupola (born December 6, 1980) is an American politician and a Republican member of the Honolulu City Council since 2021. She was a member of the Hawaii House of Representatives from 2014 until 2018. In 2015, she served as the minority floor leader for one year. She currently serves as the Minority Leader making her the first Samoan woman to serve in that position. Tupola was the Republican nominee for Governor of Hawaii in 2018. ==References== *Official page at the Hawaii State Legislature *Campaign site * Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:Politicians from Hawaii Category:State legislators of the United States Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:American Latter Day Saints
title: Andria Tupola
